topic.title: Configuring Ethernet

body.p: Switchtec provides a 10/100M MAC interface for connecting an external Ethernet PHY device and it is only available on the large package variants of Switchtect (96/80/64 lane variants). The Ethernet driver provides the basic hardware interfacing and packet management for receiving and transmitting packets. The processing of the actual packets is done by the TCP/IP stack that runs as a separate thread. Switchtec only supports IPV4.
There are two interfaces supported: RMII and MII mode.
When using RMII mode, On chip GPIO Pin 49 ~ 59 must be set as Ethernet mode, which is the default GPIO MUX value for GPIO 49 ~59.;

When using MII mode, On chip GPIO Pin 60 ~ 67 must be set as Ethernet mode, which is not the default GPIO MUX value for GPIO 60 ~ 67. Users can use CHIPLINK's on-chip GPIO Multiplex settings tool to set GPIO[60~67] with Ethernet functionality.
